Reviews.Content: I chose the Lamplighter based on proximity to business I had in the area and the Tripadvisor comments. I had limited expectations based on the price and ended up being pleasantly surprised. Had a standard room and it was absolutely spotless. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows soft. There was a comfortable chair to sit in with an adjacent table and a desk as well. The room was decent in size. Management was very cordial which made it even better. The adjacent neighborhood is marginal and it is not convenient to the tourist areas but I suppose the draw would be that it is near San Diego State. This is really a quality spot at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Winner!”
Reviews.Author: rockmorejohn
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego several times a year on business and have stayed at many hotels to qualify my contribution . And, by far the Best Western Lamplighter Inn was the nicest and most comfortable hotel meeting travel expence limit of less that $100/night. The office manager Len went of his way to make sure that I was dialed-in on all the great places to eat and hip places to visit on my week-end business lay-over.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right--nice staff, clean hotel, fun pool, great deal all around.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyBeachGuy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my wife and 2 young boys to the San Diego zoo, and was floored by the hotel prices. A historic place like Hotel del Coronado might be worth $250+, but I couldn't understand why so many regular places were $180 and more? We just needed a safe/clean/pleasant place to rest our heads for a night, and take a cool-off swim. I read the good reviews and choose the Lamplighter, and was so happy with it. The staff was exceedingly nice, and gave us a great tip (and directions!) to Filippi's restaurant in Little Italy, which was excellent. The pool was heated and fun too. There's a YogurtLand a block away for tasty dessert, plus a Woodstock's pizza (brings back memories of UCSB). San Diego State is close by so it feels safe and active at night. The pool and rooms are set back from the road so they're nice and quiet. They also had a good Continental breakfast, and even 2 of those brunch-style waffle makers where you can make your own waffle. I was initially skeptical because it's not in the heart of San Diego or on the beach, but it's a quick 10 minute drive (it's just east of Hotel Circle) to the zoo, so honestly, why bother paying so much more?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerVillach
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service. Cozy and super clean rooms. Given the many truly lousy places where you can end putting your head to sleep in San Diego, this is the place to be ... provided you have a car. Because the location is far off from downtown and the usual places of interest. You really cannot find good restaurants in a walking distance and even the fast food places are very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bed very comfortable. No backache. The A/C fan stayed on all the time. No on and off to wake me up. The staff was friendly and helpful. Told us about a Chinese restaurant and printed out a map. The welcome key packet had a list of restaurants within walking distance. The breakfast was good. Cereal, toast, bagels, waffles, juice, fruit, hard boiled eggs, etc. The grounds were well kept. The parking spaces were a bit narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value and great service”
Reviews.Author: CAEastbaytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while moving my daughter into her dorm at SDSU. The service was first rate. Every time I asked a question, the person behind the desk went way beyond, researching answers online, or drawing me detailed maps. We brought our dog, and the entire experience was very relaxing. No heavy handed "rules." She came to the pool with us, and our ground floor accommodations were so convenient (and comfortable). The rates would be a bargain even without the breakfast. Very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation - very happy”
Reviews.Author: TAS20
Reviews.Content: This was the first of many accommodations we stayed in during our trip to California and we were very happy. The room was very clean and spacious, breakfast was good and the pool was clean and warm. A few shops and restaurants were in the area but you need a car to visit the main attractions in San Diego if you are a tourist (which I guess most people have). It was about a 20 minute drive to the harbour or Sea World which we were quite happy to do. The staff were pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: disneypapa
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at front desk. Better than average accomodations with a good price. Location somewhat remote for our purposes (baseball road trip to Petco Park downtown), but the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Starskyboy
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my Husband and son (22mths) for my . Booked this hotel down to reviews on trip adviser and have to say I am so glad we did. Our hotel room was spotlessly clean so much so that after cleaning up a little juice spillage on the carpet, expecting the cloth to be a little dirty from rubbing the carpet, the cloth was clean. Handy kitchen for cooking and large fridge. Staff were so helpful. Pool area was again, spotless and there was a BBQ (which was spotless also) for use. Very handy laundry room with all you need. Central location for the Highways and short walk to supermarkets & shops. Only missed having a little bit out back for my boy to run around freely but we were out sightseeing most of the day so wasnt too badly missed. We would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A nice motel near SDSU”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March 2009 as well as July 2009. My daughter will be attending SDSU as a freshman this fall so we chose this motel for it's proximity to the campus. Both stays were pleasant and the staff was very cordial. It's not a luxury property by any stretch, but a very CLEAN, comfortable option. As an aside, they are doing some remodel work and sprucing up the property. Rooms that we stayed in had new carpet, upgraded bathrooms and 4 or 5 huge comfy pillows on the bed. A good place to stay if you don't mind being at least a 15 to 20 minute drive (in no traffic) from the S.D. metro area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: spinkid
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a great motel, although I suppose I was expecting more of a hotel. If you need to stay in this area, near San Diego St. Univ I think it is an excellent choice. If you are looking to explore San Diego, it would not be my first pick. That being said the staff was friendly and the room was immaculate. Some of the reviews here lead you to believe it is some real hidden gem of paradise, in reality, it is in kind of an average neighborhood, with average rooms, an average to small pool area. Parking is free and the wireless internet worked great in the room, those are two bonuses. Its a good 15 minute ride to the heart of San Diego, which can be more with traffic. I don't think you'll be dissapointed staying here, but don't set your expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: christine182
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lamplighter because of positive TA reviews and were not disappointed - it met and exceeded our expectations! The staff was so very friendly and welcoming, they greeted us with boxes of M&M's on arrival, which our kids loved. The room was large, clean, and well appointed. The pool is heated and well maintained, I liked that fresh towels were placed out by the pool so we didn't have to use our room towels. The breakfast room is clean and inviting, and the typical continental breakfast fare is augmented by a "make your own" fresh waffle station - loved it! Good fresh coffee and juice too. We really loved this place, we will absolutely come back here, and for a longer stay. We were only here a night, so we didn't fully get to take advantage of the good-sized kitchenette, but that's a "must" for families with young children, and the Lamplighter offers it. Also, we are former San Diegans (SDSU alumni), so we knew the neighborhood well and can assure anyone wondering that we felt very safe and secure at the Lamplighter. Yes it is on El Cajon, but *NOT* the sketchy part of El Cajon. It's right by SDSU, in a family-friendly neighborhood, and only a few minutes drive from the 8 freeway. If you are coming to SD with children, skip the overpriced and tourist-ridden Hotel Circle and stay at the Lamplighter - it is a wonderful property at an incredible value!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - a gem!”
Reviews.Author: mwooduk
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a hotel before that ASKED you to review them on Trip Advisor. You know they must be confident! This place seemed out of the way on our GPS but we wanted a hotel close to downtown San Diego but not too pricey as we were traveling with my elderly mother who is handicapped and on a budget. Turns out the motorway is just down the street with easy 15 minute access to downtown San Diego. The handicapped acessible room for my Mother was wonderful with a huge bathroom. My husband and I had a two room suite on the second floor - nice cold a/c, cute little kitchen and two queen beds in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the main room. The pool is small but heated, no jacuzzi. Lovely flowering bouganvillae all around the complex. The breakfast room is quite small, but the choices good. However, if you are bringing someone in a wheelchair, there is not much room in the breakfast room - we had to help someone in a wheelchair who was travelling soho and it was tricky although management is super helpful to all who visit. You can get free DVD rentals at reception too! There is always coffee and free highspeed internet access in reception and the staff is very helpful at all times. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great family motel!”
Reviews.Author: liberrygal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family during the last weekend in May. Booked after reading the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor. The reviews were correct- the customer service was excellent. We stayed in a family suite (living room, kitchen, bedroom). The room was clean. The breakfast was perfect for the kids- they ate well (waffles, cereals, bagels, hot chocolate) every morning. The waffles (you make your own) were really delicious. My young niece and nephew did get a chance to swim in the heated pool. One of the staff members saw them swimming and asked me if they would like to use some floaties ("noodles"). I thought that was a nice gesture. Didn't get to meet the infamous David...but the front desk manager was really pleasant when I checked in. Sea World and San Diego zoo are about 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: Lesmira1960
Reviews.Content: This is a nice older motel. The staff are very accommodating and helpful, particularly the manager David. We had a comfortable and clean apartment with kitchen and separate bedroom (2 queen beds). The apartment had a flat screen tv in both the lounge room and bed room. Breakfast was in a room next to reception and was plentiful. There is a computer at reception that is available for guests to use to access the internet (complimentary). A bonus was being able to purchase discounted tickets to Seaworld at the office. This motel is situated quite a distance from the tourist spots and downtown San Diego and as a result you really need your own transport. Tour operators don't pick up from this far out and cab fares are $40+. Public transport is available but not really suitable unless you're happy to spend 1 to 2 hours travelling in too and from the Zoo/Seaworld etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinarily clean, nice amenities, and they make you feel right at home.”
Reviews.Author: travelin2sum
Reviews.Content: Recently my partner and I visited San Diego and decided to give this little gem of a hotel a try (its been rated in the top 10 on trip advisor forever and was less than $100 dollars a night with our AAA discount!) We were delightfully surprised. The property is well maintained, and the rooms are immaculately clean with nice linens and big fluffy pillows on the bed. We enjoyed the pool area, the cute continental breakfast lounge, and the very friendly and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Gem”
Reviews.Author: shogun025
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one evening prior to our Cruise. It is a great little motel, well kept and very clean. We have stayed in some RCI Royal Crown resorts that were not kept up as well as this little gem. During our stay it also included breakfast. A little off the tourist area but if you have a car it is no problem. San Diego is not that large. I would highly recommend it. You just can't beat trip advisor for references. We will not travel anywhere without checking Trip Advisor comments out first.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: FozzyMadeley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staying at the Lighterlighter for 8 nights, combination of business and pleasure. This is upmarket "motel" type accommoadation of the very highest order. Most impressive is the level of service, friendliness and welcome provided by the General Manager, David, and the rest of his team. We have travelled worldwide and stayed in hotels of all levels, but the Lamplighter provides service of the highest order at a very reasonable rate. The pool was excellent, and the breakfast provided us all that we needed. Thoiugh we were not travelling with our family, it would also be an excellent choice for a family stop. But make sure you have a car, as the hotel is some miles out to the east of San Diego (which actually suited us fine). I recommend the Lamplighter to you most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual "Find" in San Diego's Eastern Suburbs”
Reviews.Author: David_from-Telluride
Reviews.Content: I'm staying once again at the Best Western Lamplighter Inn, on El Cajon Blvd. in San Diego, near the College Area (SDSU). I own a small lodging operation in Tellluride, Colorado, near the world-renowned ski resort, so I'm sensitive, as a lodging operator, to issues relating to first class hospitality. I can only say, I'm so impressed with this modestly sized and modestly priced motel, I was moved to write a review while still here. Although not in the tourist areas of San Diego, it's very convenient to SDSU, and moreover, easy on/off at 70th St. exit to I-8, which makes it simple to get just about anywhere from here. The Spanish-style buildings evoke a 40's era film set in Los Angeles, a very positive "retro" effect in the best sense of these words. The grounds are beautiful; the pool very well maintained, the rooms clean, simple, nice. Any contact with mgmt is very friendly, supportive, highly service-oriented, intelligent. And they remember returning guests in a way that no large hotel could manage. They can't do enough to ensure a very pleasant stay for their guests. So highly recommend this to all, including business travellers or families with children. So much value for dollar, an "oasis" of well-managed hospitality in a world where this is becoming harder and harder to find. David from Telluride

Reviews.Title: “Beds are terribly uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: We did choose it because we did not want to stay in Mission Valley, as MV is cut through by an Interstate and all hotels/motels are facing the Interstate that always has heavy traffic. Noisy place (have been there twice before). Would never recommend staying in Mission Valley! This motel style BW (you park outside your room if you get a room on 1st floor) is situated on El Cajon Boulevard in Mesa, about 10 miles from Mission Valley and you wonâ€™t hear any traffic noise in your room. You will find lots of shops and restaurants, a Starbucks and a Ralphâ€™s nearby, all walking distance. The room was spacious, we had a QQ. It is perfectly maintained and clean. Unfortunately there was no fridge/microwave in the room. But there is the usual ironing equipment. Large counter with small sink is in the back of the room. Bathroom was very tiny with tub and toilet, hardly any space to turn around. Enough towels provided, as well as shampoo and soap. There is a hair dryer as well. All clean and looking new. The only problem I had was the beds. They are too soft and old and one night I could not sleep at all, getting back aches. Most horrible beds we ever had! Thatâ€™s why I never would come back again. They have a cozy pool in the court which is right on the parking lot and surrounded by plants and trees so you wonâ€™t have the expression, it is on the parking lot. Nice place! Seems to be heated. No jacuzzi though. In the back of the buildings (2 complexes) is a guest laundry and even a tiny dog meadow. Wifi-Internet is free but did work only for a few hours, after that we never got connected anymore. But they have a free computer to use in the lobby. So no problem at all. Breakfast room is too small, only a few tables cramped in there and not enough space on one morning. We had to take our food to the room that morning. The next we found a place in the breakfast room which was ok. Small variety of food but ok. I would recommend this place because it is well maintained and has a great little pool but canâ€™t because of the much too soft old beds that will give you back-ache. Rate was about 89.-

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and perfect stay - it will be our spot in San Diego every time”
Reviews.Author: manzoorf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 8-13th and I must say this was the perfect place for us. Please note - we had a rental car. Overall - If anyone is looking for a luxury, full service hotel, this is not it. But it is a beautiful motel with pristine rooms, great beds/pillows, clean bathrooms, superb water pressure and a nice pool area. Rooms - Rooms were very clean and a good size and we never felt cramped at all (we had the dual Queen room). The bathroom was exceptionally clean. The tub and tiles were gleaming ! Let me take a quick second to address the supposed thinness of the walls. We had zero problems with noise from neighboring rooms, outside cars, pool noise or TV's. The Lamplighter Inn should be your absolute top choice for a stay in San Diego. Plus the rooms were under $100/night. A++ value ! Staff - Vanessa and the rest of the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. High Speed Internet - Was ok. Slow in the early evening hours when perhaps many other guests were sharing the wireless link. Laundry - Was very convenient to have on premise laundry. We took full advantage of this. Breakfast was great - choice of multiple breads/bagels, muffins, cereals, toast, waffle maker, boiled eggs, juices, milk, coffee and tea. Yes - no yogurt. The neighborhood around the hotel was good - we felt safe but its not anything fancy. Rite Aid and CVS are one block away. Starbucks is close by as are Ralphs and Vons (grocery stores). There are also lots of great ethnic restaurants around the University Area - we recommend the food at Best Thai in particular. Distance to Attractions - Perfect location for rental car. 15 -20mins from Sea World, Zoo and Old Town. About 30-45 minutes from Legoland and the Wildlife Park. 20-25 minutes from La Jolla and Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine - it's a motel”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: I think I was expecting more than "just a motel" based on the rating that the Lamplighter got on this site so at first I was a little disappointed. But, that's my own fault for having high expectations for what it is - it's a motel!! When you pull up, you realize it's on a street with a few other motels in a part of town that's not really near anything touristy. It's a motel that the parents of the nearby college apparently stay at and I can see why. It's almost within walking distance (but probably driven by most) of the college and two drug stores, but that's about it. My husband and I walked around the block one morning and saw a fraternity/sorority row and a neighborhood. For our purposes, location was just fine. We drove all over the place for the 5 days we were there (La Jolla, Del Mar, Sea World, Zoo, Wild Animal Park) so it was a fine home base location. I felt safe there and the staff at the front desk were nice, although I only talked to them upon check-in. Rooms were fine and the free breakfast was fine as well. It was free so no complaints! Make your own waffles (always fun), 3 cereals to choose from, danish, bagels, OJ, apple juice, hard boiled eggs. My only negative about it was the thinness of the walls. My goodness could we hear anything through them! Our neighbor watched tv at odd hours and so we were listening to it pretty clearly at 2am, 4am etc. That was a little frustrating. It's a very reasonably priced motel in a decent location for driving places. The parking is free so that's a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kunfushuss
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price. Had no problems whatsoever, and the manager was super-friendly. Breakfasts were nice and so was having wifi. There was lots to do in the general area, but you'll be driving everywhere except to maybe a couple shopping spots and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey_Family08
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, well located, helpful and informative staff. Close to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: NorCalChick
Reviews.Content: I have to say the Lamplighter Inn is one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed at recently. The room was clean, spacious and seemed like most of the stuff in the room was new. The bed was very comfortable along with the pillows. I slept like a baby. The continental breakfast was great. Fresh hot waffles along with fruit, cereal, bagels and tons more. The manager David was fantastic!! He knew everything there was to know about San Diego and made my trip even better by helping me plan my days with exciting things to do and great restaurants along the way. THANK YOU DAVID!! The staff at this hotels was great, from Vanessa who checked me in to Charlie who helped me with my bags to my room even though he was busy cleaning up the property. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: callieSF
Reviews.Content: I went to SD to visit family over the Thanksgiving holiday. I stayed on the ground floor at the Lamplighter - the room had a full kitchen which surprised me - stove, refrig, microwave plus pots, pans and dishes. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable -great pillows!! The front desk person Sarah was very helpful and had lots of information about restaurants and things to do. A nice bonus was having breakfast available, some of the best waffles I ever had. All in all it was a great trip and I would recommend the Lamplighter to anyone going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel belongs in La Mesa Hotels, not San Deigo”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in room 118 at Best Western Lamplighter Inn in La Mesa for less than $100, all-in. We like BW because we know we'll always have wi-fi, and the Lamplighter Inn's was the strongest signal of all the hotels where we stayed. Check out was at 11. Hot air blower heating. Easy parking. Cars park in front of rooms, but there was no great disturbance of cars coming and going. The cable TV includes HBO. Good breakfast with 2 waffle machines that worked quickly. There were boiled eggs, danish rolls, no yoghurt, but good orange juice, and cereal. The breakfast room with about 7 tables was next to the office so it was easy for the staff to replenish items. The room and friendliness of the staff were very good, but we really needed a refrigerator. We'd recommend the Lamplighter Inn for those who don't need a refrigerator and who don't mind being in La Mesa. A room with a refrigerator would cost about $10 more, which would make the room rate less competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: mamachev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BW Lamplighter Inn over the Thanksgiving holiday based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were pleased with our stay. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The inn is not too far from the freeway and accessible to the many main attractions that San Diego has to offer. We went to Legoland and it was about a 35 min. drive from the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was very good. Fresh warm waffles, cereals, juices, coffee, tea, fruit, and pastries. Just enough for my family to be fully satisfied. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Must go to the front desk for a wireless card. I guess my only complaint would be was that our beds were not that comfortable. Other than that everything was good. If you're looking for luxury this is not the place for you. It's a nice clean place to lay your head down. Would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure To See A Business So Well Run.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyGuyLondon
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews available prior to booking a suite at the Lamplighter and the hotel lived up to them really well. We stayed for 13 nights from mid to end of November 2008. I had asked via e-mail for a suite as far away from the road as possible and was pleased when we arrived to find that this had indeed been possible. Our room was extremely clean and kept that way by housekeeping throughout our stay. Generally the whole place is kept really nicely, everything in its place, clean, organised, smart and presentable. The pool and parking area with the grass and palm trees are very pleasant and given the space available I don't see how they could be made better. Our suite had 2 queen beds in one room then a door to the sitting room with armchair and sofa bed. TV,s in both rooms. Wash basin just outside bathroom, nice powerful shower with un-ending hot water. Full kitchen with everything you really need but not more. There was plenty of room for my partner and I for our extended stay which was why we booked the suite so we would not be couped up. Beds were very comfortable. The breakfast room is small but we always managed to find somewhere to sit if we wanted to, just had to wait a few minutes a couple of mornings. Breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice, the waffles are good and the coffee is ok to start you off in the morning. Parking was easy, we had no problems at all getting a space almost right outside our room everytime. As far as the people at the Lamplighter are concerned there are to kinds. 1st the staff who we found to be warm, friendly, welcoming, hospitable, professional, helpful and informative in all of our contact with them, they cannot be faulted. 2nd the other guests who in the overwhelming majority were just ordinary folk. However as will be found wherever you go there was a rogue few percent who had little consideration for others. These ones slammed doors, talked / shouted loud and late, left a mess on the breakfast room floor and their table full of rubbish for someone else to clear. As mentioned previously these were the exception and not at all the norm. If you get one of the noisy ones next door to you it does show up the walls as being rather thin. We have stayed at many places with higher star ratings than the Lamplighter and have been dissapointed at some of them. The opposite is true at the Lamplighter where the 2 star rating does not do it justice, it really deserves a third star. If you are realastic with your expectations of this 2 star hotel (ie not expecting 4 stars) you will not be dissappointed. If we ever come back to San Diego I really cannot imagine taking the risk of staying anyware else given the great experience we had this time at the Lamplighter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: tallmama
Reviews.Content: My family was going to Sea World and after reading all the wonderful reviews of the Lamplighter, I thought I'd give them a try. Some reviews on TripAdvisor had rates under $90/night, but I could only find more expensive prices online. So I called the hotel directly. The lady who answered the phone offered me a lower rate--I was thrilled. The room was clean, the sheets soft, the beds comfortable. We'd ordered a crib and it was assembled and waiting in our room. Unfortunately, the next morning I found a moldy bagel in the breakfast room. I didn't complain immediately--I was travelling with two toddlers and frankly felt too tired and harrassed. But I did fill out the comment card that was in the room. To my surprise, the manager of the hotel called me to apologize. He said he was so upset to hear that I'd had a bad experience. Then he insisted on taking $50 off my bill. I was floored. He also said that he'd talked to his whole staff and that "this would never happen again." I believe him. The bottom line: this hotel really does go the extra mile. It is a fantastic deal close to downtown and Sea World. I will certainly stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DaveLebo
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for $80/night. Don't let the small lobby fool you. Great place for the price. Two story motel with exterior corridors. Not too fancy, but very nicely decorated, exceptionally clean, and very well maintained. The stairs and corridor were spotless, a door mat perfectly placed in front of every room, towels placed on lounge chairs by the pool ready for the guests. The room was a reasonable size with double queens. Bedding, wall color, and wall pictures all coordinated. Only one sink, but excellent shower head. And, every staff member was extremely pleasant, helpful and friendly. If I was picky, I would point out that the free breakfast room is rather small. We could hear the people in the room next door arguing on the phone (with a raised voice), so I suppose the walls could be better insulated. But, really, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: wahili
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and it's close proximity to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo.. We were very happy with every aspect of our stay. The front desk staff were polite and efficient, our room was spotlessly clean, and the breakfast selection was good. As "walk in" guests we were offered competiive rates, with a reduction for the second of our two-night stay. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: brettnyc
Reviews.Content: stayed there for few days prior to convention in san fran,,room was clean, no funny odors,confortable bed,, and yes waffles, waffles waffles.,,the free breakfast buffet was better than most hotels, eggs,cereal, numerous kinds of pastries,,and yes a waffles machine,which i took part of everyday,, the staff more than hepful with all my needs.....I.E. directions,computer usage, and overall knowledge of the area and its attractions...would definately stay here again,, oh i didnt mention the prices...excellent..call hotel for unadvertised pricing,,thank you staff at bw lamplighter, i know you guys read these sometimes, great job keep up the great work... brett

Reviews.Title: “I love this place...many returns!!!”
Reviews.Author: lamplighterfan
Reviews.Content: My parents have been Sno-Birds to San Diego for the last 21 years. This has been their favorite of all and for the last quite a few years! I have come and seen why for the past couple of winters. I cannot tell you how much it means to me... That my parents are staying at such an awesome place. The management team and their staff are unbeatable. They cater to the snobirds, as well as, regular guests like me. I very rarely get the hospitality I get here. No question is a dumb one, especially the ones my folks can dish out. There has been quite a group of regulars that come every winter and I just love to see them and how the staff treats them. Did I mention the rooms and pool are beautiful and the vareity breakfeast goodies are so yummy. The location is right in the middle of everything...never too far from the fun. I am a super busy person and for me to take time and praise this establishment.....its gotta be a 20 star. Many returns for me!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stop over”
Reviews.Author: DCFMalaga
Reviews.Content: Felt a little nervous when we approached the El Cajon area but it was an unessary worry. The hotel was very well run, clean, well kept and the staff were so helpful with the odd problems we had. There are shops nearby and a few useful restaurants. Access to the Freeway is close and therefore useful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanadians08
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 nights at this location I can honestly say that we were really happy with our stay . We had relatives with us from England and needed to book 2 rooms . We had checked out some of the reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to make the booking . The rooms were really clean , the grounds well looked after and the staff very friendly and helpfull . The pool was cleaned everyday and clean towels put on each of the loungers ready for guest to use . The breakfast area is a little small but it was nice to sit around the pool area with the well kept garden and see the humming birds while having breakfast . If you have a car this is the pefect location , everywhere that we needed to go to was within a 15 to 20 minute drive . The directions that the Manager gave us for the the different locations that we went to were perfect . This place is well worth the money . After leaving here we stayed at a Courtyard Marriott for $205.00 a night ( more than double what we paid at the Lamplighter for one night ) The pool was not clean and you had to pay $12.99 for breakfast !!!! You want value for your money stay here. Happy Travelers Surrey BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: jinnyt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights here, our room was right over the breakfast room but we had no noise. Ths room is a little dated and the bed kind of hard and lumpy but not the worst I have had. The room was very clean. The best thing about this place is the breakfast, you get to make you own waffles and they taste great, loads of choice for food and very friendly staff. The young man in reception was very helpful and advised us on places to visit and how long to allow for each visit. The only other problem we had was finding somewhere local to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: serenityseeker2008
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a cheap and decent place to stay in san diego then i would highly recommend this Inn/motel. the concierge serice was good. our room had a musty smell but overall it was well kept. it had all the basic amenities including a microwave oven. the locality was not that great- in the midst of a busy city area. but there was no crime or anything suspicious noted at any time. there is small breakfast room and a small pool. overall it definately met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Gr
Reviews.Content: We, two adults and a nine years old child, stayed at the Lamplighter Inn on the 8th of July for two nights. Very nice Motel. Clean and on a street with little traffic. That means quiet a good condition for sleeping after a hard day of exploring San Diego. Very friendly staff. The guy at the reception gave us a double room for the same rate. One room was equipped with a sofa, TV and a complete kitchen and the other room was the sleeping room with an additional TV. More than enough space for only three people. Breakfast was more than average. Bagels, Muffins, Waffle, Toast, Juice and more. Every time when one thing ran out a staff was available to fill it up again. Only the breakfast room itself was too small for all the guests. Conclusion: To stay here you canâ€™t make something wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great value”
Reviews.Author: flos
Reviews.Content: A really friendly hotel and fantastic value for money. The reception staff and manager were very chatty and helpful both when we checked in and throughout our stay. The hotel is not centrally located but, in the university area, it is within easy reach of downtown (15 minutes drive?). The plus here is that the area is quiet and well-equipped with stores for any travel essentials. The rooms are large, clean and quiet and we had a good night's sleep. The selection at the complementary breakfast the following morning was comprehensive although the breakfast room is a little on the small side, you are invited to take your breakfast by the pool or in your room. Free internet access in the reception was useful for checking flight times the day we left. Once again, a really friendly and good value for money hotel which we have no hesitation in recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: feelymerl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Lamplighter Inn on the way to a wedding in Ensenada. I had read the good reviews of this hotel and wondered whether it would live up to them. I'm pleased to say that it did in every sense. From the time we arrived till the time we left, the staff could not have been more pleasant, friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the breakfast was above average with a good choice of food. Although the breakfast room was small, there was no problem in taking a tray back to the room - or even better, eating outside by the pool in the sunshine. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterJeterfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights end of July as we had A SOCAL pass and we travelled from Anaheim to San Diego in order to see Zoo/Sea World.. The Room was O.K clean. we had a Microwave and Fridge.It was close to the Freeway and attractions. Front desk staff very friendly and welcoming. Spoke With David Birt who I beleive is the Manager. He seemed a friendly guy took an interest in our San Diego trip.Pool area seemed nice. Breakfast was good .Breakfast room small but if it is full you can eat by the pool which we did on one of our days. If you are up early you would not have a problem. For the price we paid we were very satisfied with our stay and we would recommend this Motel

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a frugal families.”
Reviews.Author: flansy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the infamous Comicon weekend. I state this, because it was used a few times as an excuse for things that were not right (not getting the room we requested, our room card not working after check-in, no parking left in the parking lot) and it didn't really make sense. Certainly there are other times the hotel is book solid, this is a pretty popular hotel in San Diego, what do they say when they don't have comic nerds to place their "oops," on? Otherwise, this is a standard Best Western, well kept, in a pretty good location for a family or anyone wanting to save some money by getting one of their kitchen suites and taking advantage of the pool and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAZ
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Lamplighter Inn based on Trip Advisor reviews! We had decent expectations but not over the top due to the great rate we received. It was my husband and myself traveling with our toddler for our first official family vacation. From the minute we pulled into the parking lot, we felt safe and at home. The grounds were well maintained and everyday we saw maintenence cleaning up and the managers out and about talking with guests and their own employees. I once saw a manager tell the employee what a great job she was doing in keeping up with the breakast rush! We were able to check in early, no questions asked. We got the exact room type we wanted. The room was immaculate! I could not get over just how clean the bathroom was!! Our son had no problems sleeping on the pull out sofa. The room was a nice size and had a mini fridge and microwave for snacks. The free deluxe continental breakfast was a high point and the waffles were cooked to perfection!! The hotel had very easy access to major freeways, a local mall and many eateries. We were only about 20 minutes from sea port village and 15 minutes from Sea World. We will be recommending this hotel to all our friends and family!! A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: got2gogurl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here at the end of june for 5 days and have to say that i loved it! Now if you are expecting a 5 star hotel, please rethink your travel plans! But for a place that feels like home, with a great staff you can not go wrong staying here. The rooms are of good size, the breakfast in the am is fresh and you can even make your own waffles, The pool area is well kept and very relaxing. This is the one of the best hotels i have stayed at and i usually do stay at 5 stars.. Thank you to Len and Dave for making me feel so welcome and i will stay here again when i come back to san diego!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel... well woth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Owen999
Reviews.Content: We booked this superb little Hotel on the strength of previous reviews on Tripadvisor. What a GEM! Rates were very reasonable. Our party 2 x adults and 1 x child (14) had a mini king suite with a fold out double setee bed. Rooms were immaculate with mini kitchen with a fridge and microwave. Small pool area was 'spick & span' and never busy. My expereiences of FREE Continental Breakfasts in the States on previous trips had given me cause for concern... NOT HERE! Breakfast was served in an annex off reception. Breakfast and quality of food stuuf were EXCELLENT! Free car parking was a further bonus. Within easy driving of Downtown San Diego. Stayed 5 x nights - Brilliant! Staff very helpfull and curteous... !

Reviews.Title: “Just like home.”
Reviews.Author: bezfam
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called to reserve the room to the moment I checked out I felt like I was family. They treated me and my family like we were important and the only ones there. They remembered our names, our room number and made sure our stay was relaxing and convenient. Every morning--and sometimes the evenings too--I walked into the office and asked for restaurant recommendations, beach preferences and driving directions, among many other other things. I never felt like I was bothering them or a nuisance, even if I was. They smiled and entertained me with a plethora of useful and fun information that was perfect for us and our needs as a family with two young children. Len, Bryan, Vanessa and the GM Dave along with the grounds keeper/maintenance man, who's name escapes me right now, were very welcoming and seemed to like their jobs. There are so many "little" things that made our stay so enjoyable. When we were swimming at the pool the GM and maintenance man went and got my children a blow-up beach ball --just because. When I needed to wash a few loads of laundry on the premises I was given soap that another customer had left behind. The continental breakfast was way more than just coffee, juice and muffins. It was enough variety to keep us pleased for a week. The breakfast worker ran her butt off too keeping everything stocked and clean. The rooms had very comfty beds, perfect pillows, were clean, and fully stocked with the necessities. Ours also had a clean fridge and microwave. Our stay there was so enjoyable that we extended it a day. We went to another BW up the coast the following night and missed Lamplighter. It just wasn't the same. This isn't a 5-star hotel but it gives you a lot of bang for your buck. I have payed much more and gotten much less in other places we have stayed. So if you are looking for a basic room that is clean, convenient and with a pleasant staff you will get what you want at the BW Lamplighter.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Affordable for families”
Reviews.Author: preciouslizzy
Reviews.Content: Our famiy and I booked this room based solely on the reviews. I couldn't believe a little motel could get such high ratings but I knew there had to be a good reason...trip advisor has always been good to us. First, let me start by saying their staff is great. They are very friendly and helpful. I booked with a AAA discount and paid the low price of $116 WITH TAXES! Being a family of four we appreciated the savings and used it to go to the Wild Animal Park. We purchased two day passes for Sea-World from them and got 2-day passes at a discounted rate. The rooms are clean and comfortable for families. They accomadated our early check in and knew our name on arrival from our phone call before we arrived. Word of advice, try to arrive early because the parking lot can get pretty crowded. Other than that I would defintely recommend this for people on a budget looking for a nice, safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: jmcjmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lamplighter Inn and Suites for six nights in late June '08. Our choice was based solely on "Tripadvisor" ratings, following a very last minute change in our vacation plans (flying in from Vancouver BC). I can say unequivocally that we do not regret our decision. This is a small but well managed establishment. Rooms are clean (which is the most important factor in selecting a hotel). Staff are very courteous and helpful. The reception area is not 5 star but it does have a computer with free internet access. We had no problem whatsoever with the (free) parking; maybe a bit tight if you drive an unusually large vehicle. The hotel is NOT located in the immediate vicinity of major San Diego attractions like the beaches, the zoo, Balboa Park, the "old" San Diego, Legoland and SeaWorld but it's right off the interstate and with a GPS, a no-brainer to get around. The first night, we had noisy neighbors and we could smell cigarette smoke in our supposedly non-smoking room. However, we were promptly moved (read "upgraded") to a better room the very next morning. The general manager, David Birt, was quite accommodating. No questions asked. BTW, I strongly recommend a room with fridge and microwave, especially if you're with kids. Noteworthy is the fact that there is a VON's supermarket a few blocks away where you will find everything you might need. After a long day on the road, we thoroughly enjoyed their roasted chicken brought back to our room with a glass of wine! Also, there is a delivery pizza nearby called "Milo's". Their pizza is top notch. The breakfast is quite basic, as described in other reviews, but OK to start the day. Waffles, cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, boiled eggs, the usual continental breakfast suspects. The room where it is served is indeed quite small and you may have to wait for a table (we did) or else bring the food back to your room; better yet, eat it by the pool. There are two Starbucks nearby where you can have a better coffee than the one served (really quite watery). Bottom line: for the price, you're not likely to find better value in the San Diego area. Would I recommend this place or stay there again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, wonderful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2EandC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week while taking the kids to the San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Wild Animal Park and Lego Land. While it's not exactly next door to any of the attractions, it's close enough to all of them to make it convenient. We stayed in a family suite, which included a small but complete kitchen, (with what appeared to be a nice assortment of cooking utensils -- not that we even cracked open the storage container holding them!) along with a seating area completely separated from the bedroom. It was perfect for letting the kids go to bed a bit earlier while we stayed up and watched TV for a bit to unwind from the day. The staff was remarkable -- friendly and attentive to our needs. The rooms were immaculate and though we were right next to the pool, it was quiet and peaceful in our room. Breakfast was nothing special -- waffles, pastries etc. -- but it was more than sufficient to get us ready to face the parks. All in all a wonderful stay in a hotel I would be happy to visit again. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: happytrails1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in San Diego for a trade show. Although it's an older Best Western, the Lamplighter is very clean and well-kept, and the staff is excellent. Traveling with 3 small dogs, we appreciated being able to stay somewhere that didn't consign us to a smelly pet room. In fact, they were shampooing the carpets in the room we were supposed to stay in, so they upgraded us to a mini suite at no extra charge. The motel is near shopping & restaurants, but is amazingly quiet. The parking lot is a little tight and the dog "business" district is tiny, but all in all we thought it was great value. We'll definitely stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The little motel that can”
Reviews.Author: WaipahuTraveler
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Lamplighter through TripAdvisor and thought how could this little motel be rated #2 in San Diego. I decided to give them a call and spoke to someone at 2:00 a.m. their time. To my surprise the night clerk was very pleasant, knowledgeable and gave me a fantastic AARP rate. In less than 10 minutes I had an e-mail confirmation for my reservation. So far, so good. As I approached the Lamplighter I passed San Diego State and realized that the motel would be in a working-class/business neighborhood. Okay with me. There were a number of restaurants nearby and a couple of supermarkets. Mission Valley, for shopping, was only about 6 miles away on I-8. As I pulled in I noticed that the motel was very neat and clean. All of the employees seemed in motion doing something, and several of them were cleaning. We came over on a red-eye and arrived at about noon. I met Len, one of the managers, and he promptly checked my family in early. The room was good-sized, very clean, the furniture and fixtures looked new. Most impressive was that the bathroom was sparkling and there was a Delta massaging shower head that I had seen in a 4-star hotel in the bath/shower--a very nice touch. Better yet, the water flow was strong with lots of hot water--unlike many of the hotels that put those terrible water-saving low-flow shower heads on. A welcome relief to a weary traveler. The beds were very comfortable--better than a lot of hotels costing twice as much. Very important. When I discovered that there was no refrigerator in our room I asked Len about the possibility of getting a room with one. No problem--he had one delivered to our room the next day. The hotel is centrally located. We used it as a jumping off point to visit the Zoo, Wild Animal Park, Legoland (twice), and even Knott's Berry farm. Freeway access is very easy. Hop onto I-8 then you can get to I-15 or the 405 and get anywhere. The best part of the Lamplighter is the staff. Now I know how they got their #2 rating for San Diego area hotels/motels. Dave and Len, the managers, and all of the help were truly nice and friendly. Everyone said hi with a smile and made us feel welcome. Every hour of daylight was used cleaning, fixing, or doing something that made the place nice. Fresh towels on the pool chaises. A nice size pool that was very clean. Immaculate. Breakfast was better than the usual continental fare. It is basic with a couple of nice waffle machines, 3 choices of dry cereals, an assortment of bagels and pastry, fruits, juices, milk, and coffee and it is well-stocked. This definitely saves you time and money in the morning, and they are open until 10:00 a.m., not the usual 9:00 a.m. closing. The staff made great suggestions on places to eat such as the Casa Machado 2 doors away. We had dinner there for 4 out of 6 nights. When you tell them the Lamplighter sent you the service gets even better. The people at the Lamplighter were nicer than staff at a good number of 4-star hotels that I have stayed at. The bottom line is that you could pay a lot more and get a lot less. If Macy's had customer service half as good at the Lamplighter, Nordstroms would be out of business. Aloha from Hawaii. We will return and we hope to see Len and Dave again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD BUT”
Reviews.Author: glenberry
Reviews.Content: Yes i booked a night at this hotel on the basis of trip adviser reviews - it is difficult to fault the hotel - it does everything well - clean rooms - reasonably big for the price - very friendly staff - OK breakfast - BUT Location is a bit out of the way - and I think I was expecting more based on reviews. I note another reviewer recently made similar comments - ad read with interest the reply from the manager. He made some good points - SD is a dear city - and the hotel is great value - and its good so many previous guests were impressed/. Yes trip adviser does only measure guest satisfaction - but is that not the key measure - many $300-400 hotels would love to get the satisfaction ratings of this place. So there you have it- a very safe bet if you can cope with the location and basic nature of the property.

Reviews.Title: “San Deigo's Best”
Reviews.Author: Lora21
Reviews.Content: Lamplighter was exactly what I imagined an American inn to be like, the staff were friendly and helpful with places to eat, ample parking and a lovely pool to cool off in. Room was basic but clean - would recommend for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated on Trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: SimsBurton
Reviews.Content: I basically put all my eggs in one basket and booked based on trip advisor reviews. Hotel or should I say motel was VERY average. Nothing great nothing horrible. The Good - Clean rooms - Helpful/friendly staff - Cheap The Bad - Beds are quite uncomfortable - rooms are small - no amenities - very far from beach/good dining - in college district (not very nice area) If you are looking for a very no frills place to stay this is it. Given its popularity I had expected much more. Just want to give fair warning.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sebage
Reviews.Content: Fabulous. This is a simple and no frills inn (look at the price). But it over delivers in every way. The room was immaculate. Impecibly clean. The staff very friendly and helpful. Choose a room near the back of the property which is delightfuly quiet. Review the location as it is not in the center of San Diego, but if you have a car there is nothing to fault this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 hotel for the area”
Reviews.Author: robo1940
Reviews.Content: The staff are VERY accomodating and helpful. Any questions we had they had answers. The pool was very comfortable and we were able to take in our 7 month old baby. David was GREAT. We had questions about places to go to plan for a wedding and he was very helpful. The rooms are good size with a kitchen that made life so easy when you are traveling with an infant.They have totes that have everything that you need to cook. We will definitely stay there again and would easily recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and safe”
Reviews.Author: Candycanerica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the nights before and after our Carnival cruise to Mexico last week. We chose the hotel because we like Best Western, the reviews were good, and the price was right. Well, the reviews were all correct. The hotel is pretty no-frills, but we felt safe, it was quiet, the hotel was clean, and the staff was nice and accommodating. The first time we stayed, we took advantage of the continental breakfast provided, which was pretty nice. At that breakfast, we were told we could stay past the 11am checkout if we wanted to, since that was pretty early to leave for the cruise. Upon our return 5 days later, we wanted to check in early, around 10am. I called to make sure they'd have a room ready that early. They did not have an upper floor room available, as we prefer, but they did have a lower one available for us when we arrived. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, clean, comfortable place to stay while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for San Diego Area”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid March. Arriving late from a long transatlantic flight into LAX. Easy to find the hotel and the staff were most welcoming. Great to have some coffee on arrival!! The hotel was busy but just enough parking spaces for all even though they could be tight if you are parked next to one of those "US monster trucks". The room was on the second floor and was a good size, small bathroom, with basin at the end of the bedroom area. Very clean throughout the stay. I had seen some comments about the "thin walls" and yes it is true. Seem to be some people waking up at 6am having showers! However, two very comfortable Queen beds and one of the best continental breakfasts on our tour of CA which was always topped up with goodies. The kids are now converted to waffles in the morning. Very nice pool which could have benefitted from having a hot tub, but that is getting picky. The staff were very helpful with ideas on where to go and provided directions. Plenty of leaflets in the lobby and there is a PC with internet access which was very useful. Not much in terms of restaurants within close walking distance, but a short drive up El Cajon Blvd we found Woodstock's Pizza which became a favourite. There are plenty of shops within short driving distance to stock up with beers and refreshments and we made good use of the fridge in the room. I would classify this as an excellent Motel in the suburbs of San Diego. If you are looking for a 5 star Hotel in the city centre with room service, bell boys and all the trimmings of luxury then this will not fit the bill. It is located close to the main highway so excellent access for trips into Downtown San Diego and the brilliant Zoo. One tip is to park at the Old Town for free and get the Trolley into San Diego where kids travel for free. This trolley route goes onwards to Tijuana and makes for a great day out. It was also very good starting point for our next stop in Anza-Borrego via the excellent DZ Akins deli which was located just before we joined the highway Our family of four had a great stay and would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: osuguy10
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel last week and the reviews are correct. Very clean hotel with a great attitude at the front desk. The breakfast bar is wonderful and it is very easy access to all of the attractions in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was full but don't know why”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSue24
Reviews.Content: We only needed a room for 1 night and after staying in Hampton Inn for 3 straight days I was glad that it was only for 1 night. The hotel is located about 15 minutes from downtown San Diego and the traffic traveled very quickly on the highway. The area that the hotel is in could be called a working class neighborhood and felt ok during the day but we stopped for gas at night and there were drunk people and homeless looking people walking around . I had booked the room because I wanted to have a room large enough for 2 adults and 3 teenagers. The room has a large kitchen, foldout couch, tv , full bathroom and the adjoing room has 2 queen beds and a tv. After staying several nights in a Hampton Inn , which we paid $151 a night , and then staying here for $143 a night I think that they are charging too much. The pillows are very small and flat but the beds were comfortable. The breakfast area is well staffed but the eating area is very small. Most people were getting something to eat and taking it to their room. The only hot foods were waffles and instant oatmeal. The door to the breakfast room was left open to the outside so I can see it would be easy for insects coming straight into the room. If that door is to remain open then I would suggest adding a screen door. The hotel staff is extremely polite and helpful. Their great attitude does not make up for the questionable area of the hotel, small pillows, little breakfast area and what I think is too high of a rate for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget concious traveler”
Reviews.Author: annafies
Reviews.Content: Very clean place with friendly helpful staff. The room and hotel grounds were nothing special, but very clean. Really can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nell47
Reviews.Content: Our room was basic, no-frills, but updated and very clean. The grounds were nicely kept, breakfast was good, and the manager was very nice. The only negative thing that I can say is that the neighboorhood was somewhat run-down looking, although I felt perfectly safe at the hotel. If you are on a budget and looking for a clean friendly hotel, then this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Little Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: MisterOL
Reviews.Content: My mother lives in El Cajon and we need to go down to visit her frequently. Since her place is small and she has cats we needed to find a hotel that was both convenient and reasonably priced. We found that and so much more in the Lamplighter Inn. First off, the staff is so friendly you fell like you are talking to old friends. David, the general manager really makes you feel at home. The hotel is not fancy, but it really is nice and very, very clean. I doubt you could find a nicer place to stay in this price range. This is my go-to destination when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: nimbus6303
Reviews.Content: my wife and i (from minnesota) have stayed here 10 nights over the past 4 months. what sets this property apart from many others is the outstanding quality of the staff--helpful, knowledgeable, and efficient. while it is an excellent location for us, it may not be for others. but the bus stops very near the hotel, and the staff showed us how to take the bus to balboa park. we did, and it worked out well. we are seniors, so this cost us only $8 round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best in San Diego? Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: DJ139
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a one-night stay at the Lamplighter, which we chose based upon the TripAdvisor reviews and rating. For the first time, Trip Advisor has let us down. I find it impossible to believe that the Lamplighter is the second-highest rated hotel in all of San Diego! It is not great value for the money; it is simply an inexpensive motel, with nothing special or remarkable to recommend it. It is located on a busy street in a marginal neighborhood. The "lush landscaping" of the grounds consists of a few palm trees dotting the parking lot which makes up most of the site, and a patch of grass by the small pool (separated from the parking lot by only an iron fence). We booked a room with a kitchen because it happened to be the best rate available. The room was large in area, but so badly laid out and drearily decorated that it felt cramped and depressing (the kitchen was a total waste of space, especially since it wasn't stocked with cookware or dishes- the cupboards and drawers were completely empty). The furniture was ugly and drab. The room was not well sound-proofed; each time our upstairs neighbors took a step, it sounded like elephants were marching across the ceiling. The bathroom was fortunately very clean, but the polyester-blend bath towels were thin and not very absorbent, and left a flurry of lint everywhere. The complimentary breakfast did feature a good selection of pastries, cereals, waffles, juices and fruit, but the pastries were stale and tasteless and the coffee (in styrofoam cups) was bad. The Lamplighter is by no means a dump or a dive; it was clean, and the one staff member we dealt with on check-in and check-out was polite and efficient. But it does not by any stretch of the imagination deserve the inflated rating it now enjoys on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Every one is correct, this is a wonderful hotel, a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Retired12-31-06
Reviews.Content: Please scroll down and read Crown Jewel Value and Wonderful Hotel, they say it all. We choose this hotel for our week in San Diego based on earlier reviews and agree with all the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greekgoddess-iwish
Reviews.Content: We had 6 in our party (4 adults, 1 teenager, and 1 child) and stayed for 2 nights. It really is a nice hotel...the staff is fabulous. They are friendly and helpful. Everything everyone else says is true: pretty property, good price, clean and tasteful rooms, beds were comfortable, pool is heated to 85 degrees year round, good breakfast, discount zoo tickets available, free parking and wi-fi, and it is literally a 20 minute drive to anywhere! There is a small Italian restaurant down El Cajon called Etna's where the food is good!

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: ariesgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for about $75 AAA rates, room 205. The room and the hotel is very very clean. However, I do have the following problems: -- shower water temperate is unstable - constantly going from hot to cool to hot minute by minute. Water pressure not too good either. -- very thin walls.- lucky I brought earplugs, and with windows closed and AC off, I was able to sleep. However, once the earplugs fell off in the middle of the night, I was woke up by water dripping...either in my bathroom or next door. It's also located on a busy street and my room is towards the front so there's a lot of noise from cars going by. -- breakfast area a mess, probably because the hotel is busy during Spring break with lots of families and little ones. It's also very stuffy and I had to eat by the pool which is much nicer. -- parking - ample but quite narrow. Park in the spots on the right of the driveway when you enter the hotel - those spots are less popular and it's easier to pull out. -- didn't provide lotion nor conditioner -- not in the best neighborhood but ok. Good things: -- very comfortable bed -- good WiFi signal from my room -- breakfast selection not bad (DIY waffle, instant oakmeal, cereal, juices, coffee, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, toasts, danish, plus TV. -- clean pool, heated. -- friendly staff -- definitely affordable rate in San Diego -- convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Very good value...no problems”
Reviews.Author: themoogal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. This is a well-run and well-maintained older property. The facility is in a fairly run-down college neighborhood, so the nice grounds almost look out of place. The rooms are small and outdated, but the decor is up to date. One thing for sure, the staff is EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. We only stayed one night, and checked out early, so we didn't use the pool or eat in the breakfast room, but I peeked at both, and they appeared acceptable. What I didn't like was the location. Other than SDSU, there is not much in that neck of the woods. It's not very convenient for the ocean, but not TOO far from Balboa Park. I think this would be a good place for a family with kids who want to use the pool, they have some rooms right over the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JoeNY
Reviews.Content: The Lamplighter staff led by Len did a great job to make our stay a good one. This is a place that gets the importance of customer service and recognizes that accomodating the individual needs of its guests helps to greatly enhance those guests' vacations.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: saz038
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 4 week family holiday to the US and stayed at the lamplighter inn in mid Feb. Although the hotel was located some distance from the touristy part of town it more than adequately met our needs. The reception staff seemed cheerful and were happy to assist in giving directions and advice on hotels (try the mexican restaurant a block or so down the road - cheap but great food!!). When our toilet blocked up early in the morning(which I hear is a common occurrence in California) we called reception and within minutes the maintenence man was there to fix the problem. Apart from that our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. On a couple of occasions my children made use of the swimming pool which was clean and heated with fresh towels always available. The free continental breakfast each morning was sumptuous with waffles (a favourite amongst the kids and my husband), cereal, toast and danishes and fresh juice. My only gripe was the size of the dining area. It only accommodated between 12-15 people at at time which meant you had to stand and eat occasionally. (the management do suggest going and sitting by the pool to eat but as it rained and was cold on a couple of days this wasnt feasable. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the lamplighter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Pieprz
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled and surprised by the cleanliness, service, and overall quality of this budget priced hotel. After having an awful experience at a hotel directly next door to this hotel, the Lamplighter was a welcome surprise and home away from home. What a difference 50 feet makes! By the way, as a kosher traveler this hotel offers a great and mostly kosher breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: JDJD9999
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with excellent management and staff. I have experienced plenty of hotels over the years and I must say this was one of the best experiences I have had in years. The rates at this hotel are a bargain compared to the service and quality of other hotels in the area. This hotel should be rated higher than a 2* The staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. I contacted the hotel directly and my reservation was completed promptly. I requested a room with a full kitchen, a microwave, and a full bathroom. When I arrived at the hotel, check-in was very easy and the room was exactly what I had requested. The room was clean and the appliances were also spotless. You get a TV with a remote and lots of channels. There was also an alarm clock in the room. Utensils, cookware, dish wash, and a cleaning pad were also provided. You get a free continental breakfast everyday from 6am-10am. The breakfast includes fruit juices, muffins, toast, cereal, danishes, fruit, coffee, milk, fresh waffles, and additional items. There is plenty of seating for breakfast and there is also a TV in the breakfast lounge. There is also free wireless Internet. In addition, there is a computer at the front desk that customers can use to browse the Internet. The hotel also includes a pool, parking, and vending machines. You can do your grocery shopping at the nearby Ralph's or Von's. It is only a 7 minute walk to either store. Additionally, there is a Rite-Aid Pharmacy located nearby if you need to get some medicine. There is also a shopping mall that you can walk to within 10 minutes. Due to medical reasons I was required to travel to the United States and I stayed at this hotel for 11 nights. As you can imagine, traveling to another country for surgery can be extremely stressful and life changing. The staff at this hotel made it extremely easy for me to concentrate on healing. These people made my recovery easier to handle. I am eternally greatful. I would like to thank Len, David, Jerome, Kay, Vanessa, Charlie, Maria, and the cleaning staff for their outstanding service, social skills, and positive attitude. I would also like to send a message to the owner of this hotel ... this is a wonderful group of individuals and I would request that you continually reward them for the service they provide your customers and the public image they maintain for you. They are great ! I recommend this hotel to all people staying in the San Diego area. This hotel may not be the newest Sheraton, but It's a GREAT bargain and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Lamplighter”
Reviews.Author: fredzzz
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and affordable with a very cordial staff. Expanded continental breakfast was tasty and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kcrossqbee
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a really great place to stay in San Diego, this is it! Great value, super location, clean, but most of all, we left after three nights, commenting on how friendly and helpful EVERYONE was that worked at the Lamplighter Inn. The "attitude" was so good and upbeat, no matter how tired and weary we were, the employees of the Lamplighter Inn brought smiles to our faces. There is no doubt in our minds that any future trip to San Diego will include a stay at the Lamplighter!

Reviews.Title: “Near UCSD but Worth the Drive for Budget Vacationers”
Reviews.Author: CorysFamily
Reviews.Content: I was so happy here, I forgot to take pictures. Sorry. All the furniture in the room is updated and the bathroom is nice and clean. No frills â€“ but a nice place to stay. The continental breakfast is above average, with a waffle maker and Apple/ orange juice thatâ€™s not from the super-concentrate machine. The location is out of the way for vacationers (15 minutes from Old Town along the 8), but if your going to be at UCSD â€“ this is the place to stay. The staff was excellent on both shifts and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets - book at Lamplighter”
Reviews.Author: NAFROESE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 week driving trip with 3 little children. Our best hotel experience was Lamplighter Inn at San Diego due to the incredible hospitality of Len and David. We were concerned about the 2* rating however were blown away with the CLEANLINESS of our room and the entire facility, FRIENDLINESS of the staff and SERVICE from Len and David in particular. If you want a fantastic deal you cannot go wrong with this hotel. It was GREAT. You can't even come close on value. We stayed for 9 nights (weekly rate is available, great deal - phone the hotel directly). Back in July I paid twice as much at another hotel in San Diego and it wasn't half as nice. Read all the reviews and make your choice. Lamplighter has great reviews - for good reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ravhur
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights in early January and we have nothing but positive comments to make. The rooms were in excellent, clean condition and the service from the only member of staff we encountered was amazing. Yes, the incomparable Len helped out visitors to his country with advice on what to do and see. He took $25 off our bill when we were disturbed by the people in the room above us and, in general, made our stay a pleasure. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to anyone I know that is visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: imrebeccascott
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in East San Diego at the last minute due to an unexpected funeral. We needed five rooms so I called the property personally. The staff was exceptionally nice and gave us a great rate. The Hotel was beautiful and very clean. (I'm very picky about clean!) The pool was great.....even in January, the kids went swimming anyway. The staff was very friendly and very nice. The breakfast was great too! So if you are thinking about staying here, don't think, just do it! You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Time AND money well spent”
Reviews.Author: mdiederichs
Reviews.Content: I've recently moved to San Diego to pursue a graduate degree, and therefore I was looking for a reasonable priced hotel where I could stay while getting settled. Impressed by all the positive reviews on tripadvisor, I originally booked for 10 nights. However, before getting there I was a little bit skeptical because I wondered how a relatively inexpensive Best Western hotel could make it to the top five hotels in San Diego, but I was to find out soon enough. Almost everything about this hotel turned out to be awesome. When I arrived, I was upgraded to an upper-floor room with full kitchen, which was pretty spacious and comfortable. Additionally, the room included an iron/ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, microwave plus lots of complimentary items - amenities that you usually don't find in hotels in this price range. They also provided dishes, pans, and other kitchen utensils free of charge. Although the hotel is located at El Cajon Blvd, which isnâ€™t a busy street but not a side road either, I didn't notice any disturbing street noise. I also didnâ€™t experience any problems finding a parking space close to my room. Some people might argue that the hotel is not that close to downtown, but then again it is very close to San Diego State University and other interesting venues, so I found it to be an ideal location for me. Breakfast, which was offered between 6 and 10 a.m., was way better than you would expect it to be at a regular Best Western hotel. The breakfast bar was well-stocked with appealing choices, which included waffles, a nice variety of cereals, fresh fruit and assorted pastries. Complimentary coffee was offered in the lobby throughout the day. Although I have never been in the pool it looked very nice and fresh towels were put out every day. The most important thing for me, however, was that the hotel was absolutely clean and that everyone who worked there always strived to provide prompt and outstanding service. Housekeeping was simply amazing, they would rather replace a towel that had not been used or put an extra piece of soap than forget to replace anything. Last but not least, I have to thank all at Best Western Lamplighter Inn (which includes, but is not limited to Len, the amazing front office manager who goes out of his way to give you a pleasant stay) for their help in facilitating my transition to the US and for making my stay a time to remember. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who doesnâ€™t want to spend hundreds of dollars a night, but also doesn't want to compromise quality for money. Lamplighter Inn is kind of a hard-to-find gem, as it gets you more value for your dollar than possibly any other hotel in San Diego. Almost forgot to mention that I stayed there 26 days after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: trainergina
Reviews.Content: A little far away from downtown SD but for the value and price it was a great find!!! The staff was helpful the guest were nice. It may be on a busy road but it was extremely quite. The room for continental breakfast was very nice. The room we stayed in was a kitchen suite the ceiling was slopped which gave it an interesting look.
